description.value: A set of codes that define the classification of where a patient is sent on completion of a hospital provider spell, or a note that the patient died or was a still birth. These codes and their descriptions represent concepts used in Wales and are copied from the content of the [NHS Wales Data Dictionary Discharge Destination](http://www.datadictionary.wales.nhs.uk/index.html#!WordDocuments/dischargedestination.htm) web page on 18/11/2021.

display.value: Permanent residence at nursing home, residential care home
Temporary residence at nursing home, residential care home
Temporary place of residence when usually resident elsewhere (includes hotel, residential educational establishment)
Penal establishment, court or police station or police custody suite
Patient transfer to another health board / trust
Patient transfer within the same health board / trust
Local Authority Part 3 residential accommodation i.e. where care is provided
Local authority foster care but not in Part 3 residential accommodation
Not Applicable - Patient died or stillbirth
Non-NHS (other than local authority) run nursing home
Patient transfer to Non-NHS run hospital includes private hospitals e.g. BUPA
Not applicable - hospital provider spell not finished at episode end (i.e. not discharged, or current episode unfinished)
